properties.name: camel.component.servlet.allow-java-serialized-object
properties.description: Whether to allow java serialization when a request uses context-type=application/x-java-serialized-object. This is by default turned off. If you enable this then be aware that Java will deserialize the incoming data from the request to Java and that can be a potential security risk.

properties.name: camel.component.servlet.attachment-multipart-binding
properties.description: Whether to automatic bind multipart/form-data as attachments on the Camel Exchange. The options attachmentMultipartBinding=true and disableStreamCache=false cannot work together. Remove disableStreamCache to use AttachmentMultipartBinding. This is turn off by default as this may require servlet specific configuration to enable this when using Servlet's.

properties.name: camel.component.servlet.autowired-enabled
properties.description: Whether autowiring is enabled. This is used for automatic autowiring options (the option must be marked as autowired) by looking up in the registry to find if there is a single instance of matching type, which then gets configured on the component. This can be used for automatic configuring JDBC data sources, JMS connection factories, AWS Clients, etc.

properties.name: camel.component.servlet.bridge-error-handler
properties.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

properties.name: camel.component.servlet.enabled
properties.description: Whether to enable auto configuration of the servlet component. This is enabled by default.

properties.name: camel.component.servlet.file-name-ext-whitelist
properties.description: Whitelist of accepted filename extensions for accepting uploaded files. Multiple extensions can be separated by comma, such as txt,xml.

properties.name: camel.component.servlet.header-filter-strategy
properties.description: To use a custom org.apache.camel.spi.HeaderFilterStrategy to filter header to and from Camel message. The option is a org.apache.camel.spi.HeaderFilterStrategy type.

properties.name: camel.component.servlet.http-binding
properties.description: To use a custom HttpBinding to control the mapping between Camel message and HttpClient. The option is a org.apache.camel.http.common.HttpBinding type.

properties.name: camel.component.servlet.http-configuration
properties.description: To use the shared HttpConfiguration as base configuration. The option is a org.apache.camel.http.common.HttpConfiguration type.

properties.name: camel.component.servlet.http-registry
properties.description: To use a custom org.apache.camel.component.servlet.HttpRegistry. The option is a org.apache.camel.http.common.HttpRegistry type.

properties.name: camel.component.servlet.servlet-name
properties.description: Default name of servlet to use. The default name is CamelServlet.

properties.name: camel.servlet.mapping.context-path
properties.description: Context path used by the servlet component for automatic mapping.

properties.name: camel.servlet.mapping.enabled
properties.description: Enables the automatic mapping of the servlet component into the Spring web context.

properties.name: camel.servlet.mapping.servlet-name
properties.description: The name of the Camel servlet.
